age_range.evidence: Participant describes a teaching role at a university, implying an age range common for assistant professors.

gender.evidence: Participant's language and descriptions align with a male perspective.

nationality_background.evidence: Participant states ‘I’m Russian, maybe more Russian in this case.’

location.evidence: Participant explicitly states ‘I live in Allendale, Michigan.’

occupation.evidence: Participant directly states ‘I am an assistant professor in [ORG_MASKED] University’ and describes teaching computer science.

education.evidence: Occupation as an Assistant Professor indicates a doctoral-level education.

goals_and_motivations.value: To create a relaxed learning environment for students, maintain a healthy lifestyle (gym), and explore new products and interests.
goals_and_motivations.evidence: Participant mentions ‘relaxed environment’ and ‘students tend to like watch, relaxed, content,’ ‘work out and I consume protein after workout,’ ‘trying to look at my past.’

interests.evidence: Participant discusses working out and consuming protein, teaching computer science, mentioning a trip to Texas, and purchasing items like car parts, USB cables, and a coffee grinder.

values.evidence: Participant prioritizes ‘relaxed environment,’ ‘ingredients’ as the most important factor when buying protein, states ‘price is also important,’ values ‘reviews’ and ‘critical thinking’ when evaluating products.

frequency_of_use.evidence: Participant recently purchased protein and car parts, suggesting regular online purchases.

where_used_devices.evidence: Participant conducts online research and makes purchases using a smartphone and tablet.

search_style_best_vs_first.evidence: Participant indicates a preference for researching and selecting the ‘best’ protein, suggesting a desire for quality and value.

price_preference_cheapest_vs_expensive.evidence: Participant states 'If the price is almost the same. it’s just few dollars difference. I will. Still, I can buy.'

decision_factors.evidence: Participant explicitly ranks ingredients, price, and brand as important factors when purchasing protein, and relies on reviews for other purchases.

preferred_categories.evidence: Participant purchases protein, car parts, USB cables, and a coffee grinder.

pain_points_and_or_challenges.value: Concerns about product quality and reliability, especially when reading negative reviews.
pain_points_and_or_challenges.evidence: Participant actively seeks out negative reviews to assess potential issues and prioritizes ‘critical thinking’ when evaluating products.
